channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2023120147
item.description:
Report X-2023120147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ITEM ARRIVED IN TRAILER LEAKING. ITEM WAS PLACED INSIDE HAZMAT BAG AND TOTE. DescribePack: EACH LID HAS A FACTORY MADE HOLE FOR VENTILATION, BUT THESE HOLES LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG AND TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023111253
item.description:
Report X-2023111253

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found wet and stained during unload. DescribePack: One loose cap leaked a portion of its contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We isolated the package immediately from the work space and placed it in the hazmat cage. All of the spill was absorbed by the fiberboard box. No liquid needed to be cleaned-up.

item.title: Report E-2023120132
item.description:
Report E-2023120132

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: Newton
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STEVE FORLER TRUCKING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver discovered a leaking drum when he opened the back doors of the van trailer to check securement at a fuel stop. A leaking drum had caused a puddle on the floor of the trailer. A private hazmat cleanup contractor was called to overpack the leaking drum, absorb the spilled material, and clean the trailer

item.title: Report X-2023091109
item.description:
Report X-2023091109

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CN RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A CN Mechanical employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve cap of tank car # CTCX 731039 while perform rail car inspections on an inbound train at the CN Waterloo Yard in Waterloo, IA. The employee notified the on duty transportation manager who in turn made all internal notifications to initiate a response to the incident. A CN Dangerous Goods Officer performed an inspection of the tank car and found the bottom outlet valve to be leaking from the threads of the bottom outlet valve cap as a result of the BOV not creating a proper seal and the BOV cap not tight enough to contain the leak. (The BOV cap was found to be tool tight and the BOV valve in the fully closed position upon initial inspection). The BOV valve handle was cycled several times to the open and closed position to free any debris that may have been trapped in the BOV sealing surface potentially causing the leak. The leak persisted after cycling the valve. A 24" pipe wrench was then used to turn the BOV operating stem in a counter clockwise direction in an attempt to further close the valve. The leak persisted after using the pipe wrench. A 36" pipe wrench was used to further tighten the BOV cap to stop the leak. Tightening the BOV cap further stopped the leak. (Approximately 1/4 turn). The BOV cap was loosened but not fully removed to observe the leakage volume during the above attempts to fully seat the valve. The tank car will be transloaded, cleaned and purged prior to being released for transportation. 09-20-2023 The tank car was transloaded into a shipper provided empty tank car. It was then cleaned and purged of all hazardous material. The BOV cap was removed so the gasket could be inspected. The gasket was found to be severely damaged and cut which ultimately contributed to the leak.
